messages.message: Is there a way to pickle classes defined inside a custom classifier? Trying to do that gives me an error "Can't pickle <class 'ClassName'>: it's not found as builtins.ClassName". It seems pickle/joblib isn't able to serialise classes defined in the interpreter at runtime, but I don't understand enough about how custom classifier code is executed to debug this
i ran into this when initially working on the doc splitting classifier :slightly_smiling_face: https://instabase.slack.com/archives/C06FA6A23/p1575318422080900 @arun
there’s no workaround, you need to just figure out a way to serialize the state to a JSON format and use that instead.
it’s due to the way our UDF execution framework works.
sweet thanks! i was afraid that would be the answer haha
“figure out a way” isn’t actually that hard. you can just serialize `class_instance.__dict__`  as JSON.
oh gotcha -- then deserialising would involve setting `new_instance.__dict__` ?
